Description: Shouldered green metasediment vase: with a rounded external rim set above a narrow groove. Interior completely hollowed.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Thebes (historic - Upper Egypt) (said to be from)
Curator's comments: The vessel is exceptionally well made and smoothly finished. Compare Z. Y. Saad, 'The excavations at Helwan art and civilization in the first and second Egyptian dynasties' (Norman, 1969) , pl. 29.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
